data.name: index_bootmsg
data.value: Change this option to control whether Webmin is started at boot time or not. If it is not currently started at boot and Yes is chosen, a new init script will be created.

data.name: index_inetd
data.value: Because Webmin is currently being run by <tt>inetd</tt>, you probably do not want to enable this option.

data.name: index_apache
data.value: Because Webmin is currently running under Apache, you probably do not want to enable this option.

data.name: index_restartmsg
data.value: Click this button to re-start the Webmin server process. This may be necessary if you have recently upgraded Perl.

data.name: index_refreshmsg
data.value: Re-check all Webmin modules for installed servers, and update those that appear in the 'Un-used modules' category.

data.name: access_desc
data.value: The Webmin server can be configured to deny or allow access only from certain IP addresses using this form. Hostnames (like foo.bar.com) and IP networks (like 10.254.3.0 or 10.254.1.0/255.255.255.128 or 10.254.1.0/25 or 10.254.1.5-10.254.97.127 or 2001:DB8::A0BC:0001 or 2001:DB8::/32) can also be entered. You should limit access to your server to trusted addresses, especially if it is accessible from the Internet. Otherwise, anyone who guesses your password will have complete control of your system.

data.name: access_elibwrap
data.value: IP access control using TCP-wrappers is not available, as the $1 Perl module is not installed.

data.name: access_enet
data.value: '$1' is not a valid network address

data.name: access_ecidr
data.value: '$1' is not a valid CIDR number

data.name: access_eip
data.value: '$1' is not a complete IP or network address

data.name: access_eip6
data.value: '$1' is not a complete IPv6 or network address

data.name: access_ecidr6
data.value: '$1' is not a valid IPv6 network size

data.name: access_ecidr8
data.value: IPv6 network size '$1' must be divisible by 8

data.name: access_ehost
data.value: Failed to find IP address for '$1'

data.name: access_eself
data.value: Your current IP address ($1) would be denied

data.name: access_trust
data.value: Trust remote IP address provided by proxies?

data.name: bind_desc2
data.value: This form can be used to change the port number that Webmin listens on, or have it listen on only a single IP address on your system. You can also configure it to accept connections on multiple ports, or to listen on several IP addresses. Note - your web browser may prompt you to log in again after changing the port or binding address.

data.name: bind_listen
data.value: Listen for broadcasts on UDP port

data.name: bind_enone
data.value: No IP addresses and ports to listen on entered

data.name: bind_eip2
data.value: '$1' is not a valid IP address to bind to

data.name: bind_eport2
data.value: '$1' is not a valid port number

data.name: bind_erestart
data.value: An error occurring starting Webmin with the new address and port settings : $1

data.name: bind_elisten
data.value: Missing or invalid port to listen for UDP broadcasts on

data.name: bind_ehostname
data.value: Missing or invalid web server hostname

data.name: bind_eipv6
data.value: IPv6 cannot be enabled unless the $1 Perl module is installed

data.name: bind_elsof
data.value: New port $1 is already in use by another process

data.name: bind_eonsystem
data.value: The IP address $1 is not active on this system, and so cannot be used

data.name: bind_emaxconns
data.value: Maximum concurrent connections must be a number greater than 1

data.name: bind_emaxconns_per_ip
data.value: Maximum concurrent connections per IP must be a number greater than 1

data.name: bind_emaxconns_per_net
data.value: Maximum concurrent connections per network must be a number greater than 1

data.name: log_desc
data.value: Webmin can be configured to write a log of web server hits, in the standard CLF log file format. If logging is enabled, you can also choose whether IP addresses or hostnames are recorded, and how often the log file is cleared. When enabled, logs are written to the file $1.

data.name: log_desc2
data.value: When logging is enabled, Webmin will also write a more detailed log of user actions to the file $1. This log can be viewed and analysed with the Webmin Actions Log module to see exactly what each Webmin user has been doing.

data.name: log_clf
data.value: Use combined log format (including referrer and user agent)?

data.name: log_forusers
data.value: Users to log Webmin actions for

data.name: log_inmods
data.value: Modules to log Webmin actions in

data.name: log_files
data.value: Log changes made to files by each action?

data.name: log_fullfiles
data.value: Record all modified files before actions, for rollbacks?

data.name: log_ehours
data.value: '$1' is not a valid number of hours

data.name: log_ediff
data.value: Your system does not have the command $1 needed for logging file changes

data.name: log_syslog
data.value: Also log Webmin actions to syslog?

data.name: log_login
data.value: Include Webmin logins and logouts in actions log?

data.name: log_email
data.value: Send logged actions via email to

data.name: proxy_desc
data.value: If the host on which Webmin is running is behind a firewall of some kind, you may need to set the proxy server to use for accessing web and FTP sites. Certain modules, such as <tt>Software Packages</tt>, will use these proxies when downloading files or programs.

data.name: proxy_ehttp2
data.value: The HTTP proxy server must be entered as a URL, like $1

data.name: proxy_eftp2
data.value: The FTP proxy server must be entered as a URL, like $1

data.name: proxy_bind
data.value: Source IP address for HTTP connections

data.name: proxy_ebind
data.value: Missing or invalid source IP address

data.name: proxy_eother
data.value: Missing or invalid-looking OSDN mirror code

data.name: proxy_desc2
data.value: When Webmin downloads a file from a URL hosted on sourceforge, it will automatically use the mirror site based on your selection below, where possible.

data.name: proxy_edays
data.value: Missing or invalid maximum number of days to cache files

data.name: proxy_cachebdesc
data.value: Click this button to search for and manage URLs cached for download by Webmin.

data.name: proxy_cleardesc
data.value: Click this button to delete all $1 cached URLs downloaded by Webmin, so that future downloads are made direct from the origin HTTP server. $2 of disk space will be freed.

data.name: proxy_fallback
data.value: Try direct request if proxy is down?

data.name: ui_desc
data.value: This form allows you to edit user interface options used by all modules. When entering colours, each must be specified using the standard RGB system, where each value is a hex number from 00 to ff.

data.name: ui_sysinfo
data.value: Display login and hostname (for non-framed themes)

data.name: ui_err
data.value: Failed to save user interface options

data.name: ui_nice_size_type
data.value: Use binary units of measurement (KiB, MiB, GiB rather than KB, MB, GB)

data.name: ui_feedbackconfig
data.value:
Allow all users to include
configuration in feedback?

data.name: ui_ewidth
data.value: Missing or invalid help window width

data.name: ui_eheight
data.value: Missing or invalid help window height

data.name: ui_edbwidth
data.value: Missing or invalid chooser window width

data.name: ui_edbheight
data.value: Missing or invalid chooser window height

data.name: mods_desc1
data.value: Webmin modules can be added after installation by using the form to the right. Modules are typically distributed in <tt>.wbm</tt> files, each of which can contain one or more modules. Modules can also be installed from RPM files if supported by your operating system.

data.name: mods_grant2
data.value: Grant access only to users and groups :

data.name: mods_grant1
data.value: Grant access to all Webmin users

data.name: mods_checksig
data.value: Check signature file for downloaded modules?

data.name: mods_desc2
data.value: If you wish to have more than one copy of the same module with different configurations, the form to the right allows you to clone any existing module. The clone will have a new name, a new module configuration, new access control options and may be made available to different users.

data.name: mods_desc3
data.value: Existing modules and clones of modules can be deleted, they will also be removed. Once a module has been deleted it must be reinstalled before you can use it again. A module cannot be deleted if other modules depend on it.

data.name: mods_eroot
data.value: Webmin modules cannot be installed or managed when the Webmin code is shared with another system, such as when it is running inside a Zone or mounted via NFS.

data.name: mods_desc4
data.value: Installed modules can be exported as a wbm.gz file using the form below. A module file can then be installed onto another system running Webmin.

data.name: install_ebrowser
data.value: Your browser does not support file uploads

data.name: install_enotar
data.value: The <tt>tar</tt> command, needed for extracting Webmin modules, was not found on your system

data.name: install_einfo
data.value: Module $1 is missing a module.info file

data.name: install_enone
data.value: File does not appear to contain any modules

data.name: install_eos
data.value: Module $1 does not support this operating system ($2 $3)

data.name: install_eusermin
data.value: Module $1 is for Usermin, not Webmin

data.name: install_ever
data.value: Module $1 requires Webmin version $2 or above

data.name: install_edep2
data.value: Module $1 requires at least version $3 of module $2

data.name: install_desc
data.value: The following modules have been successfully installed and added to your access control list :

data.name: install_ecomp
data.value: File is compressed, but the $1 command was not found on your system

data.name: install_egzip
data.value: File is gzipped, but the $1 command was not found on your system

data.name: install_ebunzip
data.value: File is bzipped, but the $1 command was not found on your system

data.name: install_erpm
data.value: Not a Webmin module or theme RPM

data.name: install_eneither
data.value: RPM does not contain a webmin module or theme

data.name: install_emissing
data.value: The specified module does not exist

data.name: delete_edep
data.value: Module $1 cannot be deleted, as the module $2 depends on it

data.name: delete_msg
data.value: The following modules have been successfully deleted from your Webmin installation :

data.name: delete_rusure
data.value: Are you sure you want to delete the module(s) $2 ? $1 kB of files will be deleted forever.

data.name: delete_rusure2
data.value: Are you sure you want to delete the theme $2 ? $1 kB of files will be deleted forever.

data.name: delete_rusure3
data.value: Are you sure you want to delete the module clones(s) $2 ?

data.name: delete_acls
data.value: Remove from users and reset access control settings?

data.name: os_desc3
data.value: This page displays the operating system detected by Webmin at install time, and the system that is currently detected. If they are different, you can choose to have Webmin's OS information updated, which may be necessary if you have recently upgraded.

data.name: os_desc2
data.value: You can also change the search path used by Webmin when running programs, and the shared library path passed to any programs.

data.name: os_iwebmin
data.value: Internal OS code used by Webmin

data.name: os_update
data.value: Update Webmin to use detected OS

data.name: os_incorrect
data.value: Warning - Your system is actually running $1 version $2.

data.name: lang_intro
data.value: This page allows you to choose which language Webmin will use for displaying titles, prompts and messages

data.name: ssl_emessage
data.value: The error message from Perl was : $1

data.name: ssl_desc1
data.value: The host on which Webmin is running appears to have the SSLeay Perl module installed. Using this, Webmin supports SSL encrypted communication between your browser and the server. If you are accessing your Webmin server over the Internet, then you should definitely consider using SSL to prevent an attacker capturing your Webmin password.

data.name: ssl_desc2
data.value: Warning - only turn on SSL support if you have a browser that supports SSL, and there is no firewall blocking https requests between your browser and the Webmin host.

data.name: ssl_redirect
data.value: Redirect non-SSL requests to SSL mode?

data.name: ssl_honorcipherorder
data.value: Force use of server-defined cipher order?

data.name: ssl_ekey
data.value: The SSL private key file $1 does not exist

data.name: ssl_ekey2
data.value: The SSL private key file $1 does not contain a PEM format key

data.name: ssl_ecert
data.value: The SSL certificate file $1 does not exist

data.name: ssl_ecert2
data.value: The SSL certificate file $1 does not contain a PEM format certificate

data.name: ssl_newkey
data.value: This form can be used to create a new SSL key and certificate for your Webmin server.

data.name: ssl_newcsr
data.value: This form can be used to create a new SSL key and certificate signing request (CSR) for your Webmin server. The CSR must be signed by a certificate authority (CA) before it can be used.

data.name: ssl_hole
data.value: Because you are currently using the default Webmin SSL key that everyone has access to, you should generate a new key immediately. Otherwise your SSL connection is not secure!

data.name: ssl_eextraca
data.value: Additional certificate file '$1' does not exist

data.name: ssl_ipkeys
data.value: This section lists additional SSL certificates that will be used for connections to particular IP addresses.

data.name: ssl_ipkeynone
data.value: No IP-specific SSL keys have been defined yet.

data.name: ssl_addipkey
data.value: Add a new IP-specific SSL key.

data.name: ssl_pfs
data.value: Only strong ciphers with perfect forward secrecy

data.name: ssl_ecipher_list
data.value: Missing or invalid cipher list - must be like <tt>HIGH:-SSLv2:-aNULL</tt>

data.name: ssl_edhparams
data.value: Failed to generate PFS DH params file : $1

data.name: ssl_epfsversion
data.value: PFS requires Net::SSLeay version $2, but this system only has version $1

data.name: ssl_fromcsr
data.value: This private key was generated using the Certificate Signing Request tab. You should enter the certificate below that was supplied by your CA in response to the CSR.

data.name: ssl_savekey
data.value: This form allows you to upload an existing PEM format SSL private key and certificate for your Webmin server to use.

data.name: ssl_current
data.value: This section shows the details of the current Webmin SSL certificate, and allows it to be downloaded so that it can be accepted by your browser.

data.name: ssl_edownload
data.value: Failed to extract PEM data from certificate

data.name: ssl_csralready
data.value: View most recent key and CSR ..

data.name: ssl_letsdesc
data.value: Let's Encrypt is a free, automated, and open certificate authority that can be used to generate an SSL certificate for use by Webmin.

data.name: ssl_letserr
data.value: Unfortunately, Let's Encrypt cannot be used on your system : $1.

data.name: ssl_letsdesc2
data.value: This page can be used to request a new certificate, which will overwrite any other currently have configured in Webmin. However, the Let's Encrypt service requires that your ownership of the certificate domain be validated by checking that this system hosts the website for the domain. This is done by placing a small temporary file in the website's document directory.

data.name: ssl_webroot
data.value: Website root directory for validation file

data.name: ssl_usewebmin
data.value: Copy new key and certificate to Webmin?

data.name: newkey_essl
data.value: An error occurred generating a new key :

data.name: newkey_ecat
data.value: An error occurred writing to the new key file :

data.name: newkey_ok
data.value: Successfully generated the following SSL key :

data.name: newkey_edays
data.value: Missing or invalid number of days before expiry

data.name: newkey_ecountry
data.value: Country code must be two letters

data.name: newcsr_ok
data.value: Successfully generated the following SSL certificate request :

data.name: newcsr_ok2
data.value: This CSR must be sent to a signing authority, who will return a signed certificate. This can be installed with the key above using the Upload certificate tab.

data.name: startpage_intro2
data.value: This page allows you to control the appearance of the main Webmin menu. Some options may only be effective when using the default theme.

data.name: startpage_ecols
data.value: '$1' is not a valid number of columns

data.name: startpage_gotoone
data.value:
Go direct to module
if user only has one?

data.name: startpage_nohost
data.value: Show version, hostname and OS in title?

data.name: startpage_gotomodule
data.value: After login, always go to module

data.name: startpage_webminup
data.value: Show Webmin updates on System Information page?

data.name: startpage_moduleup
data.value: Show module updates on System Information page?

data.name: upgrade_descgentoo
data.value: This form allows you to upgrade your entire Webmin installation to a new version by removing the current Gentoo Emerge package and installing a new one. You can install from a local Gentoo package file, an uploaded file or from the latest version in the Emerge repository. Just as with a manual upgrade, all your config settings and third-party modules will be kept.

data.name: upgrade_delete
data.value: Delete old version's directory after upgrade?

data.name: upgrade_err2
data.value: Failed to upgrade from uploaded file

data.name: upgrade_err4
data.value: Failed to upgrade from Emerge repository

data.name: upgrade_ebrowser
data.value: Your browser does not support file uploads

data.name: upgrade_elatest
data.value: You are already running the latest version of Webmin

data.name: upgrade_erpm
data.value: Not a valid Webmin RPM file

data.name: upgrade_edeb
data.value: Not a valid Webmin Debian package file

data.name: upgrade_egunzip
data.value: Your system does not have the <tt>gunzip</tt> command

data.name: upgrade_etar
data.value: Not a valid Webmin tar file

data.name: upgrade_setup
data.value: Running setup.sh script to upgrade Webmin .. Please wait a minute until it is complete before continuing.

data.name: upgrade_setuprpm
data.value: Running RPM to upgrade Webmin .. Please wait a minute until it is complete before continuing.

data.name: upgrade_setupdeb
data.value: Running DPKG to upgrade Webmin .. Please wait a minute until it is complete before continuing.

data.name: upgrade_setuppackage
data.value: Running pkgadd to upgrade Webmin .. Please wait a minute until it is complete before continuing.

data.name: upgrade_esolaris
data.value: Webmin's upgrade feature does not currently work when you have installed from a Solaris package. Please upgrade manually instead.

data.name: upgrade_ezip
data.value: Webmin's upgrade feature does not currently work when you have installed on Windows. Please upgrade manually instead.

data.name: upgrade_eportage
data.value: Webmin's upgrade feature does not currently work when you have installed from a Portage package. Please upgrade using the Portage tools instead.

data.name: upgrade_eusermin
data.value: File is Usermin version $1, not a Webmin update.

data.name: upgrade_ewpackage
data.value: Not a valid Solaris package for Webmin

data.name: upgrade_egentoo
data.value: Not a valid Gentoo package of Webmin

data.name: upgrade_eupdates
data.value: Failed to download list of updates : $1

data.name: upgrade_nosig
data.value: No package signature verification done - checking of tar.gz packages is only possible when upgrading from www.webmin.com.

data.name: upgrade_force
data.value: Upgrade even if new version is the same or older?

data.name: upgrade_everify2
data.value: Package has signature from $1, but it is not valid

data.name: upgrade_everify3
data.value: Public key with ID $1 is not available for verification

data.name: upgrade_only
data.value: Don't re-install deleted or new modules?

data.name: upgrade_eroot
data.value: Webmin cannot be upgraded when its code is shared with another system, such as when it is running inside a Zone or mounted via NFS.

data.name: newmod_desc
data.value: When Webmin is upgraded, any new modules in the new version will be granted to one or more users. This form allows you to set the users who receive new modules. This setting will apply when upgrading at the command line or using the form above.

data.name: newmod_def
data.value: Default behavior - grant new modules to <tt>root</tt> or <tt>admin</tt>

data.name: update_show
data.value: Only show which modules would be updated

data.name: update_missing
data.value: Install modules that are not currently installed

data.name: update_quiet
data.value: Only report when an update is done

data.name: update_none
data.value: No Webmin updates for this version.

data.name: update_enosig
data.value: Could not download signature file for updates : $1

data.name: update_enomodsig
data.value: Could not download signature file for module : $1

data.name: ca_newmsg1
data.value: Your Webmin server is already setup as a certificate authority. You can use this form to set it up again, but any certificates already issued to users will no longer work.

data.name: ca_newmsg2
data.value: This form should be used to setup your Webmin server as a certificate authority (CA) so that users can request certificates in the Webmin Users to identify themselves to the server without having to login.

data.name: ca_oldmsg1
data.value: The CA certificate this server is using is displayed below. You may change it by pasting in the certificate from another CA, but any certificates already issued to users will no longer work.

data.name: ca_oldmsg2
data.value: If you have already setup a CA on another Webmin server, you can paste its certificate below instead of setting up a new CA. This will allow users from the other server to be recognised by this server as well.

data.name: ca_setupok
data.value: Your certificate authority has been setup successfully. Users can now use the Webmin Users module to request certificates for themselves.

data.name: ca_stopmsg
data.value: Click this button to stop Webmin from accepting existing certificates or issuing new ones. This will force users to use username and password authentication instead.

data.name: ca_stopok
data.value: Your certificate authority has been successfully shut down.

data.name: ca_eminiserv
data.value: SSL client certificates are only supported under miniserv.

data.name: ca_eversion
data.value: The version of the Perl Net::SSLeay module installed on your system does not support SSL client certificates.

data.name: ca_essleay
data.value: The SSL administration command $1 was not found on your system. You may need to change the path in the Webmin Users module configuration.

data.name: ca_essl
data.value: SSL certification can only be setup when the webserver is running in SSL mode.

data.name: session_desc1
data.value: When enabled, password timeouts protect your Webmin server from brute-force password cracking attacks by adding a continuously expanding delay between each failed login attempt for the same user.

data.name: session_blockhost
data.value: Block hosts with more than $1 failed logins for $2 seconds.

data.name: session_blockuser
data.value: Block users with more than $1 failed logins for $2 seconds.

data.name: session_localon
data.value: Allow login without password for matching users from localhost

data.name: session_eblockuser_time
data.value: Missing or invalid user blocking time

data.name: session_eblockuser_failures
data.value: Missing or invalid user blocking logins

data.name: session_ecookie
data.value: Your browser does not support cookies, which are required for session authentication

data.name: session_ip
data.value: Limit sessions to the same client IP address?

data.name: session_utmp
data.value: Record logins and logouts in Utmp?

data.name: session_realname
data.value: Show real hostname instead of name from URL?

data.name: session_pamon
data.value: Use PAM for Unix authentication, if available

data.name: session_pamoff
data.value: Never use PAM for Unix authentication

data.name: session_pfile
data.value: If PAM is unavailable or disabled, read users and passwords from file $1 columns $2 and $3

data.name: session_pamend
data.value: Pass on PAM status to other modules?

data.name: session_ecmd
data.value: Missing or invalid password change command

data.name: session_epasswd_uindex
data.value: Missing or invalid unix username index

data.name: session_epasswd_pindex
data.value: Missing or invalid unix password index

data.name: session_eextauth
data.value: Missing or invalid external authentication program

data.name: session_pmode0
data.value: Always deny users with expired passwords

data.name: session_pmode1
data.value: Always allow users with expired passwords

data.name: session_pmode2
data.value: Prompt users with expired passwords to enter a new one

data.name: session_emd5mod
data.value: MD5 encryption cannot be used, as Perl $1 module is not installed.

data.name: session_esha512mod
data.value: SHA512 encryption cannot be used, as Perl $1 module is not installed.

data.name: session_blocklock
data.value: Also lock users with failed logins

data.name: assignment_desc
data.value: This form allows you to configure which category each module is displayed under on the Webmin index page.

data.name: categories_desc
data.value: This form allows you to rename the existing Webmin categories and create new ones to assign modules to. The top part of the table is for changing the descriptions of the built-in categories, while the bottom part is for adding new category IDs and descriptions.

data.name: log_letsencrypt
data.value: Requested new SSL certificate from Let's Encrypt

data.name: log_letsencryptdns
data.value: Created Let's Encrypt DNS record for $1

data.name: log_letsencryptcleanup
data.value: Removed Let's Encrypt DNS record for $1

data.name: themes_desc
data.value: Themes control the appearance of the Webmin user interface, including icons, colours, backgrounds and the layout of pages. The selection box below can be used to choose one of the themes installed on your system.

data.name: themes_overdesc
data.value: Overlays modify the appearance of a theme, by changing the colors, backgrounds and icons. They do not change the layout.

data.name: themes_installdesc
data.value: Use the form below to install a new Webmin theme on your system. Themes are typically distributed in <tt>.wbt</tt> files, but can also be installed from RPM files if supported by your operating system.

data.name: themes_ebrowser
data.value: Your browser does not support file uploads

data.name: themes_einfo
data.value: Theme $1 is missing a theme.info file

data.name: themes_enone
data.value: File does not appear to contain any themes

data.name: themes_done
data.value: The following themes have been successfully installed on your system :

data.name: themes_ecomp
data.value: File is compressed, but the $1 command was not found on your system

data.name: themes_egzip
data.value: File is gzipped, but the $1 command was not found on your system

data.name: themes_ok
data.value: Theme changed successfully .. redirecting to the Webmin index page.

data.name: themes_ok2
data.value: Theme overlay changed successfully .. redirecting to the Webmin index page.

data.name: themes_delete
data.value: This form can be used to delete one of the themes installed on your system that is not currently in use.

data.name: themes_eoverlay
data.value: Selected overlay is not compatible with the current global theme

data.name: themes_desc4
data.value: Installed themes can be exported as a wbt.gz file using the form below. A theme file can then be installed onto another system running Webmin.

data.name: referers_desc
data.value: This page allows you to configure Webmin's referrer checking support, which is used to prevent malicious links from other websites tricking your browser into doing dangerous things with Webmin. However, if you have links to Webmin from your own websites that you don't want to be warned about you should add those sites to the list below.

data.name: referers_none2
data.value: WARNING: This opens your system up to XSS attacks!

data.name: referers_ehost
data.value: '$1' is not a valid trusted hostname

data.name: update_mmissing
data.value: Module $1 is not installed on this system.

data.name: update_malready
data.value: Module $1 is already up to date.

data.name: update_mshow
data.value: Update needed for module $1 to version $2.

data.name: update_mos
data.value: Update to module $1 is not needed on your system.

data.name: update_mtype

data.name: update_version
data.value: A new release of Webmin (version $1) is now available for download. Future updates will be released only for the latest version.

data.name: anon_desc
data.value: This page allows you to grant access to selected Webmin modules and paths without clients needing to login. For each module path that you enter below (such as <tt>/custom</tt> or <tt>/passwd</tt>) you must also enter the name of a Webmin user whose permissions will be used for access to the module.

data.name: anon_desc2
data.value: You should be VERY careful when granting anonymous access, as insufficient IP access controls or granting access to the wrong module may allow attackers to take over your system.

data.name: anon_eurl
data.value: '$1' is not a valid URL path

data.name: anon_euser
data.value: Missing or invalid Webmin user for URL path '$1'

data.name: standard_warn
data.value: Warning - you are not running the latest Webmin version $1, so these modules will probably fail to install.

data.name: lock_desc
data.value: By default, Webmin will obtain a lock on any file that it modifies in order to prevent concurrent modification by multiple processes, which could lead to file corruption. This page allows you to selectively or totally disable locking if it is causing problems.

data.name: lock_except
data.value: Lock all files and directories except ..

data.name: ipkey_eip2
data.value: '$1' is not a valid IP address or hostname

data.name: ipkey_eextraca
data.value: Additional certificate file $1 does not exist

data.name: descs_info
data.value: This page allows you to specify alternate titles for Webmin modules, to override their standard descriptions.

data.name: export_done
data.value: Successfully exported the selected modules to $1.

data.name: notif_updatemsg

data.name: notif_reboot
data.value: Recent package updates (such as a new kernel version) require a reboot to be fully applied.

data.name: sendmail_desc
data.value: This page controls how Webmin sends email, such as from scheduled backups or background monitoring. It also effects email sent using the Read User Mail module.

data.name: sendmail_smtp1
data.value: Via SMTP to local mail server

data.name: sendmail_smtp2
data.value: Via SMTP to remote mail server

data.name: sendmail_from

data.name: sendmail_esmtp

data.name: sendmail_efrom
data.value: Missing or incorrectly formatted from address

data.name: sendmail_desc2
data.value: This form can be used to send a test email with the settings above, to ensure that mail is being delivered correctly.

data.name: sendmail_url
data.value: Webmin URL for use in email

data.name: testmail_done
data.value: .. message sent. Check the destination address's mailbox to ensure that it was actually delivered.

data.name: twofactor_desc
data.value: Two-factor authentication allows Webmin users to enable use of an additional authentication device when logging in, such as a one-time passcode generator. Users must individually enroll with the selected authentication provider after it is enabled on this page.

data.name: twofactor_eusers
data.value: Two-factor authentication cannot be disabled, as the following users are currently enrolled : $1

data.name: twofactor_esecret

data.name: twofactor_esession
